body:
####  Notes on [Github Flavored Markdown](http://github.github.com/github-flavored-markdown/): 
* the asterisk is still a bullet..
* links look like: bracket name bracket parenthesis url paranthesis
> "Here's a quote, it begins with a greater than sign (and apparently isn't supported by this theme"

```
this stuff is between by two lines w/3 apostrophes
code can be put between gr8rThan & lessThan signs
```

#### Templates
* there are some cool ones, and 
1. you can edit your content whenever and keep the theme
2. you can switch to another theme and keep your content

#### Authomatic Generator vs. Manually..
* automatic still creates gh-pages branch, and you can check out out once you're done (might help explain details for doign it manually) 
* "Jekyll makes it **easy** (bold between 2 asterisks, _italics_ btwn underscores) to create site-wide headers and footers without having to copy them across every page. It also offers intelligent blog support and other advanced templating features." -- soo worth figuring that out!

# h1= one pound sign
## h2= two pound signs, and so forth
### there's a wysiwyg markdown editor

<"You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile.">
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: tryin out the automatic page generator...
name: Test-site
